Name: The First Ruler
Omen 1: Three aged nobles in ragged finery herald the rise of the First Ruler: \mythQuote{It travels to us now, from death unto it's birth. That which has never known skin. That which rightfully rules}
Omen 2: A strange Knight shares a horse with one alleged tax collector while another follows on foot: \mythQuote{Disperse and return to your masters land to work. The first ruler demands what he is due and all will face accounting.}
Omen 4: Smoke billows from a small parcel of farmland while a Knight bearing the crest of local rule watches impassively: \mythQuote{All have conscripted to service and all will report. The usurper will see no harvest.}
Omen 5: In the distance is a clearly undisciplined warband herded by 4 knights. A decisive confrontation is near.
Omen 6:
Guant peasants tend to fields previously burned. \\%

Overseers for the First Ruler watch closely over the wordless sobs of a peasant locked in a nearby stockade. All will work, and work will not cease.
Cast 1 (yaml):
name: Aged Nobles
attributes: 2 1 1 2
armor: A0 (Ragged finery)
weapons: Hand Axe \statBlock{d6}
Cast 2 (yaml):
name: Strange Knight
attributes: 16 6 18 2
armor: A2 (Mail and Shield)
weapons: Staff \statBlock{d8 Long}, Dagger \statBlock{d4}
Cast 3 (yaml):
name: Tax Collectors / Overseers
attributes: 8 6 11 4
armor: A1 (Padded Clothes)
weapons: PoleAxe \statBlock{d10, Long}
Cast 5 (yaml):
name: The First Ruler
attributes: 15 10 7 3
armor: A1 (Inscribed Plate)
weapons: Great Maul (2d10)

Name: The Waxen Slain
Omen 1: A knight haggard from restless journey: \mythQuote{I live to cover my shadow with blood; Beware, I see in you that there is dirt enough to cover your graves}. Attempts to flee onward; In his wake, 3 slaughtered and dismembered.
Omen 2: Two waxen and rotting slain: \mythQuote{I do not know you.... but you may reach your hand into the shards of bone and know me}. They seek their killer and will not be swayed from vengence.
Omen 3: A burning shack and a dubious man hunted by an unrelenting slain woman: \mythQuote{His flesh... I demand it. It is dearly owed and I will have it}. The man claims she was set upon him by cruel miracle.
Omen 4: Four shackeled slain, shambling, driven by a youthful knight in filthy plate. He knows their secret and the use of the tokens.
Omen 5: A desolate tree strung with two nooses. A boy hangs by one and a man by the other, both motionless.
Omen 6: You are set upon by up to six persons you have slain this season. You remain hunted until all have been fully dealt with.
Cast 1 (yaml):
name: Haggard Knight
attributes: 6 5 2 4
armor: A2 (Mail and Helm)
weapons: Pike \statBlock{d8, Long}
Cast 2 (yaml):
name: Waxen Slain
attributes: 6 3 5 2
armor: A4 (Tattered Clothes, Unliving Resilience)
weapons: Rending grab \statBlock{d8}
items: Moonstone token

items: Four moonstone tokens rendered smooth

Name: The White Fountain
Omen 1: Stars streak brightly across the sky. On the horizen, two flashes signal an earthly conclusion.
Omen 2: A crack in the earth blazes with dazzling light in waves of color utterly unfamiliar to you. A claimed wizard from another realm studies it intently.
Omen 3: Three black dogs converse in sputtering howls atop a large earthen mound. A witherd woman who is not a woman appraises you.
